reviews.review_msg: She's really nice, lectures are super active and very interesting, definitely recommend this prof! (And it's a good gpa booster too)
I, without any hesitation, hold back, or reservation,  recommend taking any class that this professor holds.  She is a professor's Professor.  Laoshi Jia Fei rocks!  PS  Jia is a great credit to SFU!

Every day I look forward to Jia Fei's classes! She shows that she genuinely cares about her students and even does things like tell a little story about every Chinese character to help you memorize them. She has a good sense of humour and CHIN100 with her was an easy A+!!  In addition to learning a ton, I got a great grade and had fun!!
She is such a great teacher! Her class will help any beginner. There are weekly quizes which are a spelling test and grammar test which are fair game. She is always available to help you understand.

Awesome professor! Has an EXCELLENT ear, she can clearly find out who is fluent in Mandarin and kicked 1/4 of the people who thought they were so smug that they got into the class. She takes her time to help students with pronunciation. Really nice too!

Ms. Jia Fei is a sweetie - extremely helpful, approachable, and friendly. She teaches quite well. The workload is more than fair (though there is a quiz practically every class). Not a fast paced class - suitable for beginners. The textbook is simple and straight forward. A bit of practice and review of textbook will yield an enjoyable experience!

Nice teacher with awesome personality! Extremely helful when it comes to answering questions. Enjoy the small fun class atmosphere. Material tends to be somewhat repititive sometimes. A time-consuming course but an excellent GPA booster!
This class made me want to continue studying chinese!

Quizzes everyday but they aren't necessarily hard if you pay attention in class. Textbook use was encouraged but you can pass without it, albeit with a lower grade. Definitely characters > pinyin, midterm was about 50/50 characters/pinyin but final was mostly characters. Online exercises were easy.

Daily quizzes weren't hard, big on memorization. Make sure to memorize the characters and not just pinyin, midterm was largely characters. Explains everything fairly well and gives lots of opportunity to improve your grade. Overall easy class if you put in the effort (about 1h studying/memorizing per class). Don't miss class tho
